summary: The 'Right-size the Federal Reserve Act' aims to limit the total assets of Federal Reserve banks to no more than 10% of the U.S. GDP, effective 10 years after enactment. It mandates the elimination of the Overnight Reserve Repurchase Facility within a year and prohibits the creation of similar facilities. The bill also requires annual reports to Congress regarding interest payments to foreign-owned banks and amends sections of the Federal Reserve Act related to reserve requirements.
